title: Afiq Yunos
text:
Mohammad Afiq bin Yunos (born 10 December 1990) is a Singaporean professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for the <a href="Singapore%20Premier%20League">Singapore Premier League</a> side <a href="Hougang%20United%20FC">Hougang United FC</a> and the <a href="Singapore%20national%20football%20team">Singapore national team</a> as a <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Before he was included in the LionsXII setup, Afiq was playing with <a href="Young%20Lions%20%28football%20team%29">Young Lions</a> in <a href="S.League">S.League</a>.
Club career.
Young Lions.
Afiq began his professional football career with Under-23 side <a href="Courts%20Young%20Lions">Young Lions</a> in the <a href="S.League">S.League</a> in 2008.
LionsXII.
It was announced that Afiq was to join the <a href="LionsXII">LionsXII</a> for the <a href="2014%20Malaysia%20Super%20League">2014 Malaysia Super League</a>.
Tampines Rovers.
In 2016, Afiq signed for <a href="Tampines%20Rovers%20Football%20Club">Tampines Rovers</a> for the <a href="2016%20S.League">2016 S.League</a> campaign after <a href="LionsXII">LionsXII</a> was disbanded in 2015. He has rejoined the Stags by signing a three-year contract from the 2018 season, having spent 2017 playing for <a href="Home%20United">Home United</a>.
Geylang International.
Afiq was loaned out to <a href="Geylang%20International%20FC">Geylang International</a> in June 2018 from <a href="Tampines%20Rovers%20FC">Tampines Rovers</a> for the rest of the season.
Hougang United.
Afiq signed with <a href="Hougang%20United%20FC">Hougang United</a> for the <a href="2019%20Singapore%20Premier%20League">2019</a> season, joining a slew of big-name signings for the club.
Trat FC.
Afiq then signed for Thailand side <a href="Trat%20F.C.">Trat FC</a> for the <a href="2020%20Thai%20League%201">2020 Thai League 1</a> season, on loan from the Cheetahs.
Geylang International.
On 8 July 2021, Afiq return to <a href="Geylang%20International%20FC">Geylang International</a> on a permanent transfer from <a href="Hougang%20United%20FC">Hougang United</a> for the remainder of the 2021 season.
Career statistics.
Club.
. Caps and goals may not be correct.
International career.
He was called to <a href="Singapore%20national%20football%20team">Singapore national football team</a> when the team was participating <a href="2010%20AFF%20Championship">2010 AFF Championship</a>. Afiq was also called up to the <a href="Singapore%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Singapore U-23</a> side in the <a href="2013%20Southeast%20Asian%20Games">2013 Southeast Asian Games</a>.
Others.
Singapore Selection Squad.
He was selected as part of the Singapore Selection squad for The Sultan of Selangor’s Cup to be held on 6 May 2017.
